note.p: Research Field: Eton; Trinity College, Cambridge. MA (1834)

Career: Called to the Bar (1835); practised as an Equity draftsman, Lincoln's Inn (for 10 years); Advocate General to the HEIC (1845); went to Calcutta; Puisne Judge to the Supreme Court of Bengal (1848); Chief Justice (1855); retired and returned to England (1859); Privy Councillor; Assessor to the Judicial Committee of the Council of India appeals; died of heart failure
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1882-1883 vol 34 pp x-xi signed by J D H
Notes: BR gives year of death as 1882.
